one example of a beer that uses alternative ingredients instead of hops is gruit. gruit is an ancient style of beer that was brewed before hops were commonly used in brewing. instead, brewers used a variety of herbs and spices to add flavor and bitterness to the beer.

gruit beers can taste quite different from traditional hoppy beers. they can have a range of flavors, including spicy, floral, earthy, and medicinal. the bitterness can also vary depending on the herbs and spices used, but it's often milder than in hopped beers.

another alternative ingredient that has been used in place of hops is chamomile. chamomile has a slightly sweet, floral flavor that can be used to add bitterness to beer. chamomile beers can have a delicate, fruity flavor with a slightly bitter finish.

other ingredients that have been used to impart bitterness in beer include heather, spruce tips, and juniper berries. these ingredients can add a range of flavors and aromas to the beer, from woody and earthy to citrusy and spicy.

overall, alternative ingredient beers can have a distinct flavor profile that differs from traditional hoppy beers. they can be a great choice for those who are looking for something new and different or who want to try a beer that has a unique taste.
